meanings.definition: Able to be managed or regulated.
meanings.sent1: The volume on the TV is controllable with the remote.
meanings.sent2: The speed of the car is controllable with the brakes.
meanings.sent3: Trying to control a controllable situation can sometimes lead to more chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her controllable temper suddenly flared up like a storm.
meanings.sent5: The controllable nature of the experiment made it easy to predict the outcome.

meanings.definition: Able to be restrained or directed.
meanings.sent1: The controllable dog followed its owner's commands obediently.
meanings.sent2: The controllable flow of water was redirected towards the crops.
meanings.sent3: The controllable enthusiasm of the children made the teacher's job easier.
meanings.sent4: His controllable emotions were like a calm river flowing steadily.
meanings.sent5: The controllable direction of the wind helped the sailors navigate the sea.

meanings.definition: Able to be influenced or manipulated.
meanings.sent1: The controllable opinions of the group were easily swayed by the new information.
meanings.sent2: The controllable behavior of the child was shaped by positive reinforcement.
meanings.sent3: Her controllable laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The controllable market responded quickly to the new product.
meanings.sent5: The controllable thoughts in his mind were like clay waiting to be molded.
